reviewText: This is another video of the healing in Rwanda.  It's very well done and quite touching.
I liked this documentary. It was done really well.
It's just interviews and I use it as a way to show he kids the effects of ethnic cleansing...no pg-13 plus scenes so it works to show 9th graders in a school setting...
It was hard to understand what was being said.  The sound was not very good.
I love the honesty of this couple and how they shared their working through so many issues with the help of God.  What a wonderful testimony to the life-giving forgiveness available in Jesus Christ.

I just bought this one on Video On Demand and I just wanted to test my new ROKU XDS which I got recently. I just wanted to check if the online streaming video from Amazon Works but I was really touched by this couple. I was in Rwanda in 1994 and I was 12 at that time but I still remember what happened there, it was horrible! I wish this couple could be a perfect example for young people-future generation, where a hutu is able to marry a tutsi and vice versa. May God bless this couple and all other similar couples.
